intro: Pedicularis lecomtei, commonly known as Lecomte's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic relationships with host plants. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often resembling insects. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
